title: Endless Loop of Error Messages
body: I tried to open the launcher today, I have installed the newest launcher mind you, the first time I got a message saying  "_**There was a problem patching League of Legends. We'll restore a backup version and try updating again after you restart the patcher.**_" So i clicked on the "_**Restart**_" button. The client closed and reloaded as stated, and I received a message saying, "_**We have restored this installation to an older version of League of Legends. Now we'll try to patch it up to the latest version.**_" So I click "_**Okay**_", and the first window with the error message pops up immediately after. I am stuck in an endless loop of restarting and being restored and can't login or move past the error windows. Mind you, I've had the newest launcher for several weeks, and have been up to date with all recent patches. This has not been a recurring issue, and is a first time issue. I've tried restarting my computer, running normally and as admin, i'm not sure what else to do. I will try uninstalling and reinstalling in the meantime. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

replies.body: weird how all these comments are only several minutes old... this is happening to me too

> [{quoted}](name=PokeRanger69,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=k7xmElhu,comment-id=0008000300040000000200000000,timestamp=2017-08-12T17:32:27.400+0000)
>
> FOUND A HOTFIX:
> Set the date and time back a day and an hour to fix spaghetti code

Worked for me and some other folks!
Actualy worked for me, thanks summoner! ;) {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
yea lol, on a 4 month old post. I am getting the same error loop. RIP League client. Bring back old client :P
Also glad it's not just me because the server status is fine.
Havin' the same issue.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
Ye it's happenin to me
same :/
same

It sounds to me like there could be a security setting that's blocking your game files from being accessed, so it's instantly going to result in error.  As a first step, I suggest using the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to make sure that league and its files are being added as an exception.  Let me know how that works out!
Didn't work.

I had just ended a game and i'm just waiting on the main screen when a message pops up saying this "There was a problem patching League of Legends. We'll restore a backup version and try updating again after you restart the patcher.", so i press the restart button and this message comes up "We have restored this installation to an older version of League of Legends. Now we'll try to patch it up to the latest version." once the login page reopens, i click and it immediately puts the original message back on the screen so I press restart again and the same thing happens in a loop, i don't understand the problem and i need a solution please. I am using a mac (pretty sure that's important).
The same exact story is going on with me.  I don't use a mac.

Try this:
Launch the client and when it says "We have restored...blah blah blah" don't hit okay but Alt+F4 instead and close it. Then launch the client again. That fixed it for me. If not, then try launching the admin client.
The Alt+F4 without hitting okay worked for me

PC:

Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Open "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" with notepad
Find the line:

gameflow-patcher-lock:

Delete this whole line
Save the file, restart your LoL Client - and you should be able to log in again.
-----------

Was skeptical, but instant fix.

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}

> [{quoted}](name=Wrathadox,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=tIbaNF6a,comment-id=002c,timestamp=2017-08-12T17:06:57.259+0000)
>
> PC:
> 
> Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
> Open "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" with notepad
> Find the line:
> 
> gameflow-patcher-lock:
> 
> Delete this whole line
> Save the file, restart your LoL Client - and you should be able to log in again.
> -----------
> 
> Was skeptical, but instant fix.
> 
> {{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}
